application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Variation of Conditions 3 (approved plans) to allow alterations to elevations, balcony and window detail and changes to external lanscaping and roofterrace of planning permission 00439/21/P1 dated 22/12/2017 for redevelopment of site to provide 62 apartments contained within two separate blocks of four to six stories in height with roof gardens and access to, associated car parking, access and landscaping
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from 22nd December 2017 being the date of granting of planning permission 00439/21/P1.
Condition : 2 - The development shall not be implemented other than in accordance with the materials approved under 00439/21/P1(2).

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (050 rev 00, 010 rev 00, 030 rev 00, 031 rev 00, 032 rev 00 Site Location Plan, Economic Impact Assessment (dated November 2016), Noise Impact Assessment (dated 9th August 2016), Drainage Strategy (dated December 2016), Planning, Design and Access Statement (dated November 2016), Design and Access Statement (dated November 2016) and Daylight and Sunlight Assessment (dated 12th December 2016 unless otherwise superseded by letter from Simon Herrington dated 4th July 2017) received on 14 December 2016;Sustainability and Energy Statement (dated 3rd July 2017) and Transport Assessment revision A (dated 2 June 2017 and addendum dated 10 August 2017) received on 7 July 2017. Drainage Strategy (dated August 2017) received on 17 August 2017. Viability Report (dated August 2017) received on 22 August 2017; 4954-4-21-P1, 4954-4-22-P1, 4954-4-23-P1, 4954-4-24-P1, 4954-4-25-P1 & 4954-4-26, received on 03/09/2018; 4954-3-15, 4954-4-20-P2 and  a cover letter , received on 26/10/2018; A letter from the applicants solicitors, Trowers and Hamlins, received on 20/11/2018; 11058-0010 Rev L, received on 20/07/2020; 5932-X-901, received on 10/08/2020; HOW21682-20I, 5932-900-A, 4954-3-76-F, 4954-3-70-D, 4954-3-77-C, 4954-3-74-C, 4954-3-73-D, 4954-3-72-E & Unnumbered roof terrace planting, received on 08/09/2020; HOW21682-11D, received on 10/09/2020; 4954-3-71-C, 4954-3-75-B, 4954-3-78-B & 4954-3-79-B, received on 23/09/2020; 11058-0021 Rev D, received on 25/09/2020) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 4 - The boundary treatment hereby approved shall be completed before the buildings are occupied or in accordance with a timetable agreed in writing with the local planning authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to first occupation of the approved units

Condition : 5 - Prior to the occupation of the units hereby approved the screening to be installed to external amenity space, including private balconies, to restrict overlooking into neighbouring properties shall have been implemented in accordance with the approved scheme.

Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding the submitted plans, and prior to the occupation of the units hereby approved the windows shown within the North West elevation of the six storey element of Building A (units 7, 16, 17, 26, 27, 36, 37, 44, 45 and 50) shall be fitted with shall be obscure and fixed glazing and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured and fixed glazing.

Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation of the units hereby approved the following details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the site:
- Cycle parking
- Waste storage
- A Car Park Layout Plan
- A Car Park Management Plan
- Vehicle Charging Points
- Visibility splays
- Full details of the access and access road, including pedestrian access and footways along the access road.

Condition : 8 - Following approval of details under 00439/21/P1(9a) and 00439/21/P1(9b) and before the development is first brought into use: 
The agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in clauses b) and c), including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.
Condition : 9 - The hard and soft landscaping details hereby approved shall be implemented in full prior to first occupation of the units of accommodation hereby approved.

Condition : 10 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 11 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (schedule of fittings and manufactures literature) should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved internal water use calculations.
Condition : 12 - The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the sustainable sourcing of materials standards approved under 00439/21/P1(13).
Condition : 13 - The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the details of the Bird Management Plan approved under 00439/21/P1(14).

Condition : 14 - Prior to occupation, the applicant must submit for review and approval by the Local Planning Authority evidence that the drainage system has been built as per the approved final detailed drainage designs, approved under planning approval 00439/21/P1(16,21), through the submission of photographs and copies of installation contracts, and written confirmation that the drainage features will be managed as per the detailed maintenance plan for the lifetime of the development.

Condition : 15 - Any fixed external plant shall be designed and installed to ensure that noise emanating from such plant is at least 10dB below the background noise levels when measured from the nearest sensitive receptors. All plant shall be installed in accordance with the approved plans. No further fans, louvres, ducts or other external plant shall be installed without the written prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 16 - Prior to the occupation of any residential unit, details of a scheme of mitigation for exposure to poor air quality internally for each unit shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall include the installation of Ultra Low NOx boilers, and mitigation for Particulate Matter (PM10). The development must be carried out in accordance with the approved mitigation details. The development shall not include biomass boilers.

Condition : 17 - Prior to the development being occupied, measurement reports demonstrating compliance with the Noise Impact Assessment Report 14705.NIA.01 (dated 9th August 2016), by KP Acoustics Ltd, shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
